articles.author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
articles.title: Americans *hate* the Texas abortion law - CNN
articles.description: Texas Republicans' decision to pass the nation's most restrictive abortion law earlier this month has landed like a lead balloon with voters nationally.
articles.content:
THE POINT -- NOW ON YOUTUBE! 
In each episode of his weekly YouTube show, Chris Cillizza will delve a little deeper into the surreal world of politics. Click to subscribe!

articles.author: Christina Carrega and Pete Muntean, CNN
articles.title: American Airlines and JetBlue sued by DOJ over their airline alliance - CNN
articles.description: The Department of Justice has sued two major airlines on Tuesday, alleging the companies created an alliance that raised prices and reduced choice for air passengers traveling to and from major cities in the United States' Northeast region.

articles.author: mlssoccer
articles.title: Historic reimagined Leagues Cup starting in 2023 | MLSSoccer.com - MLSsoccer.com
articles.description: In a monumental new chapter for North American soccer, beginning in 2023, every club from MLS and Liga MX will compete in a completely reimagined Leagues Cup: an annual, month-long tournament.

articles.author: Jen Kirby
articles.title: At the United Nations General Assembly, Biden says America wants to cooperate - Vox.com
articles.description: The test isn’t whether America is back — it’s whether it can help build the world Biden says it wants to build.

articles.title: Ryder Cup: American Bryson DeChambeau wants fan support at Whistling Straits - BBC Sport
articles.description: Bryson DeChambeau says being heckled by fans has not "been comfortable" but hopes his performances will get the United States fans behind him at the Ryder Cup.
articles.content:
Bryson DeChambeau's style and character seems to have polarised golf fans
43rd Ryder Cup
Dates: 24-26 September Venue: Whistling Straits, Wisconsin

articles.title: United States set to lift travel ban for vaccinated South Africans - BusinessTech
articles.description: The US will soon allow entry to most foreign air travelers as long as they’re fully vaccinated against Covid-19 — while adding a testing requirement for unvaccinated Americans and barring entry for foreigners who haven’t gotten shots.
